Articles.Content:
Hello! I have really wanted to do one of these so I am starting my own. JSSP will consist of however many modules we can put on without melting computers. Each module should be no more than 50 parts, but it can be for any purpose. Anyone can join and participate in the fun! Orbit will be at 120 Km. Best name someone can come up with will be the name for the station. Save file can be PMed from player from player.

NOTICE! PM me if you want to join. Although I'm warning you the line is getting long.

Current Station:

Launches:

1. _jack: Complete

2. Woopert: Complete

3. guz667: Complete

4. MK3424: Complete

5. WJDubs: Moved to after Emu

6. Hazard1556: Complete

7. Legendary Emu: Pending Launch

8. Tidus Klein (Dibs on Solar Array)

9. Coatimundi

10. Stinger771

11. Redrobin

12. Damaske

13. EVDE

Edited April 2, 2014 by _jack

I'll gladly join, but take a look at this. We've started it about 3 weeks ago and it's open to everyone.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/70446-The-Interkerbal-Space-Station!
150 parts is a lot. If each module was 100 or so parts it would bring many computers to it's knees. I'd suggest 20-50 parts for each module.

I'd love to join! Not quite ready at this very moment, I have some irl things to attend in the immediate term this week, but give me a day or two and I can confirm 100%.

I'll gladly join, but take a look at this. We've started it about 3 weeks ago and it's open to everyone.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/70446-The-Interkerbal-Space-Station!

I checked in on this the other day...looking great! SO much fun to see the community doing things together. Always wanted to be apart with some other peeps.

150 parts is a lot. If each module was 100 or so parts it would bring many computers to it's knees. I'd suggest 20-50 parts for each module.

I noticed that but didn't have time to fix it.

Woopert shure is a good guy, since we are waiting 'till kmp gets fixed (because of can't undock bug).

I want to participate with this challenge.

I have some experience (including IKSS participant) and have an ongoing MIR build.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

I can use my mini space shuttle to put up some small 1.5m parts/girders.
I would like to do this, I'll make a Zarya Inspired Cargo Block.

I would like to do this, I'll make a Zarya Inspired Cargo Block.

They already existed; they were TKS spacecraft design derivatives:http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TKS_spacecraft

Cool little spacecrafts that could be manned, only to be flown a few times only unmanned.

Woopert shure is a good guy, since we are waiting 'till kmp gets fixed (because of can't undock bug).

I want to participate with this challenge.

I have some experience (including IKSS participant) and have an ongoing MIR build. http://imgur.com/a/o3nJK

I can use my mini space shuttle to put up some small 1.5m parts/girders.

Sure, that would be great.

I would like to do this, I'll make a Zarya Inspired Cargo Block.

I would love to see that!
I would be interested! I'll probably add a science lab or something that looks like the Kibo module on the ISS if thats cool~
Count me in. Maybe I'll add a minitug with junior docking area.

Can we get a list of modules people are planning to put up thus far? Not sure what I want to do and I see a lot of things already being claimed...

I am thinking about making a docking section with a little fuel (Happens to make up the central structure). Should only be thirty parts. The questions I have would be: do you want a Sr. Docking port? and what orientation is preferred?

Decisions, decisions...

Edited March 18, 2014 by guz667

If i may, can i suggest to use minimal mods?

Because i wanna use these mods and why:

KAS - It will enable us to remove unnecessary RCS thrusters thus lowering part count.

6s - For placing the KAS containers somewhere and able to refuel/adding stock to the station.

TweakableEverything - enabling for more twakables.

Infernal robotics - for moving parts around the station if necessary.

If anyone else has a other mod suggestion.

let me know.

Also, i would add a solar truss section on the port/starbord side of the station using the hitchhicker hatch as the Zenith reference, leaving the Zenith/Nadir ports free for other parts.

Edited March 18, 2014 by MK3424

Meh Cont me in, Its been some time before I have built a station...... Actually I dont think I have ever made a station just half finished interplanetary ships.

YA im in! TIME TO SPACE!

DIBS ON THE SOLAR ARRAY!
Ooh, can I launch an airlock also? I have an idea for one...

Ooh, can I launch an airlock also? I have an idea for one...

We are taking turns for adding parts to the station.

It's Woopert's turn now.

but, yeah haven't thought of that.

Edited March 18, 2014 by MK3424

Ooh, can I launch an airlock also? I have an idea for one...

Yes you may. And everyone can join ^^^

Can we get a list of modules people are planning to put up thus far? Not sure what I want to do and I see a lot of things already being claimed...

I am thinking about making a docking section with a little fuel (Happens to make up the central structure). Should only be thirty parts. The questions I have would be: do you want a Sr. Docking port? and what orientation is preferred?

Decisions, decisions...

A Sr. Docking port would be great for expansion

If i may, can i suggest to use minimal mods?

Because i wanna use these mods and why:

KAS - It will enable us to remove unnecessary RCS thrusters thus lowering part count.

6s - For placing the KAS containers somewhere and able to refuel/adding stock to the station.

TweakableEverything - enabling for more twakables.

Infernal robotics - for moving parts around the station if necessary.

If anyone else has a other mod suggestion.

let me know.

Also, i would add a solar truss section on the port/starbord side of the station using the hitchhicker hatch as the Zenith reference, leaving the Zenith/Nadir ports free for other parts.

I really don't want this to be modded. That way people can use this without having to download mods.
May I claim the port on the lander can? That's where the airlock is going.

May I claim the port on the lander can? That's where the airlock is going.

Perfectly fine with me.
Can i join this? I think i can add a few tanks for refueling.

Can i join this? I think i can add a few tanks for refueling.

The more the merrier!

Oh boy...ALL DONE!

That was really tough. I had a lot of technical difficulties, both with KSP and my own designs. I was going to record it, cut it up, make a fun presentation video of less than 3 minutes...just too many difficulties. Sorry everyone.

I hope it's on to everyone's liking...

One thing I will say, be careful with the station. When I arrived and was preparing my final docking sequences...a couple of the Kerbals had somehow decided of their own volition to go EVA and hang around the station...(unless someone else put them there?) I almost didn't know notice them...their fate may have been "interesting."

Here are some pics of the ordeal...

Getting up there...

Shedding the launch stage.

The push for orbit.

Mission accomplished. Time to go home!

Tense reentry...

All done! Now could someone come pick me up...?
